JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Margarita Tsatsa-Nikolovska;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Snejana Botoucharova;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Dzhankoy . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agents , PERSON , succeeded by PERSON ORG and Mr Y. GPE .

Pursuant a contract concluded in DATE , the applicant advanced CARDINAL karbovantsi to the ORG - owned “ ORG ( ORG PERSON ) for construction of a residential house for his family . According to the text of the contract , the remainder of the funds were to be borrowed from the GPE bank . The contract did not specify whose responsibility it was to apply for the loan . Neither party secured the loan or otherwise financed the remainder of the construction costs .

The plot of land located at the address specified in the construction contract was never formally assigned to the applicant . In DATE the municipality allocated the applicant a plot for the construction of a house at a different address . He used this plot for growing vegetables .

In DATE the unfinished house , located at the address specified in the construction contract , was allocated to the NORP family , who had advanced funding for the construction of a house in DATE . Having invested their personal funds , the NORP family continued the construction and moved into the house .

By DATE ORG was privatized , its shares having been distributed between employees and other private persons , and transformed into a collective agricultural enterprise ( ORG сільськогосподарське підприємство ) .

In DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings in ORG ( PERSON міський суд GPE республіки ORG ) , seeking to oblige ORG to fulfil the contract , namely , to finish the construction of the house located at the address specified in it . The NORP family were summoned to the proceedings as a third party .
ORG lodged a counterclaim , seeking to have the contract with the applicant annulled .

On DATE the court awarded the house , allocated to the NORP family , to the applicant and dismissed ORG counterclaim . This judgment was not appealed against , became final and the enforcement proceedings were instituted to effect the house transfer to the applicant .

The NORP family refused to leave the house , referring to the lack of any decision in respect of their rights , particularly , on reimbursement of their investments and provision of an alternative residence . The applicant instituted separate eviction proceedings against the NORP family .

On DATE , while the eviction proceedings were still pending , the Presidium of ORG of GPE ( “ ORG of the ARC ” ; ORG PERSON ) quashed the judgment of DATE , following a supervisory protest lodged by the Deputy Prosecutor of GPE and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . The court instructed the first - instance court to explore further whether the applicant could claim entitlement to the house at the address in question , particularly , in view of the unclear contractual language concerning an obligation to obtain a bank loan for construction and considering that the applicant had also been allocated a plot of land for construction under a different address .
DATE the proceedings were suspended at the applicant ’s request in view of his business trip .
In DATE the applicant amended his claims , seeking punitive damages from FAC in addition to the house transfer and joining his eviction claims to the main proceedings .

On DATE the court dismissed the applicant ’s claims and the Farm ’s counterclaim . It found that the NORP family had lawfully obtained the house in issue and that the applicant ’s house was due to be located at another address . The court also dismissed ORG counterclaim . The applicant appealed in cassation .

On DATE ORG of the ARC quashed this judgment , having found the first - instance court ’s analysis insufficient , particularly as regards the legal nature of the construction contract and the parties’ obligations to secure a bank loan , and assumed jurisdiction over the case , referring to its complexity and delay in resolution .

On DATE ORG of the ARC found that an expert assessment was necessary to establish the value of the disputed house and the applicant ’s contribution in the new hryvnya currency and according to the current prices . The court obliged the defendant to pay for the assessment .

In DATE ORG was reorganized , CARDINAL entities , ORG “ FAC ” ( “ the Zaricnhy Cooperative ” ; ORG виробничий кооператив « PERSON ) and the “ K.P.A ” CJSC ( ORG Селянська промислова артіль ORG ) having subsequently emerged on its basis .

As the fee for the expert assessment commissioned by the court remained unpaid owing to the defendant ’s reorganization and financial difficulties of the emerging entities ( i.e. , ORG bank account had been blocked by the authorities ) , on DATE ORG ordered to advance the respective payment from its own budget .

In DATE the expert assessment was completed and the proceedings were resumed . ORG of the ARC determined that ORG was ORG successor in respect of the obligations vis - à - vis the applicant and summoned it into the proceedings .

In DATE the applicant altered his claim . He informed the court that , having obtained other lodging , he was no longer interested in the construction of a house and demanded termination of the contract and compensation of damage .
The defendant amended its counterclaim , advancing new justifications for the annulment of the contract .

On DATE ORG of the ARC annulled the contract , having found that its provisions did not comply with the law applicable at the material time . Based on the findings of the expert assessment , it awarded the applicant against ORG hryvnyas ( ORG ) as the equivalent to his investment into the construction and ORG CARDINAL in court fees . The applicant appealed in cassation to ORG , seeking a higher payment .
On DATE ORG heard the case on the merits and upheld the judgment of CARDINAL DATE .

On an unspecified date the enforcement proceedings were instituted to collect the debt due to the applicant pursuant the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the ORG bailiffs forwarded the enforcement writ to the trustee in bankruptcy , owing to the fact that the debtor had been declared bankrupt and subject to liquidation . The applicant did not inform the ORG whether and to what extent the judgment had been eventually enforced .

In DATE the CARDINAL members of the applicant ’s family obtained privatization certificates entitling them to privatize a share of the ORG property . The applicant alleges that they were unable to invest these certificates in a satisfactory manner on account of the unlawful conduct of the authorities .

In DATE the applicant had several arguments with post - office employees concerning the procedure of sealing and stamping his correspondence to the ORG . In addition , a delivery slip concerning one of his registered letters to the ORG was lost .
In DATE ORG allegedly failed to produce at the applicant ’s request a document certifying that he had been formerly employed by ORG .
